meanings.definition: Measures taken to protect or ensure the safety of something.
meanings.sent1: The security cameras are important safeguards in the building.
meanings.sent2: It is wise to have multiple safeguards in place to protect your personal information.
meanings.sent3: The guard dog takes his job as a safeguard very seriously.
meanings.sent4: Her friendship acted as a safeguard against loneliness.
meanings.sent5: Wearing a helmet is a simple but effective safeguard against head injuries.

meanings.definition: A precautionary measure taken to prevent harm or damage.
meanings.sent1: Carrying a first aid kit is a good safeguard for emergencies.
meanings.sent2: The insurance policy serves as a financial safeguard in case of accidents.
meanings.sent3: Bringing an umbrella was a clever safeguard against the unexpected rain.
meanings.sent4: His skepticism acted as a safeguard against falling for scams.
meanings.sent5: Having spare batteries is a useful safeguard for power outages.

meanings.definition: To protect or secure something from harm or danger.
meanings.sent1: She always safeguards her jewelry by keeping it in a safe.
meanings.sent2: It is important to safeguard your personal information online.
meanings.sent3: The knight vowed to safeguard the kingdom from any threats.
meanings.sent4: The parents safeguarded their child from the dangers of the busy street.
meanings.sent5: The antivirus software helps to safeguard your computer from viruses.
